Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 行商人
Entry.EnglishText: Peddler

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 食材屋の店主
Entry.EnglishText: Grocery Owner

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
宿屋のおかみ
Entry.EnglishText: Inn Hostess

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
<Eugene>
<Tytree>
<Hilda>
<unk19:D0FF1FC822E00C80>
食材屋「大地の恵み」
Entry.EnglishText: Grocer

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア兵
Entry.EnglishText: Callegean Soldier

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋「沙漠の館」
Entry.EnglishText: Innkeeper

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋・食材屋
Entry.EnglishText: Inn - Grocery Store
Entry.Notes: TIMED Floating text bubble, generally used after entering a place

Entry.JapaneseText: アニカマル
Entry.EnglishText: Anikamal

Entry.JapaneseText: アニカマル・宿屋・食材屋
Entry.EnglishText: Anikamal - Inn - Grocery Store
Entry.Notes: This place's name in the menu

Entry.JapaneseText: 色々あります。 見ていってくれませんか？
Entry.EnglishText: We have various kinds of articles. Won't you take a look?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 装飾品を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140> Buy accessories Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: またどうぞー！
Entry.EnglishText: Until next time!

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺はこの村の住民じゃないが 知り合いの紹介で、商売を させてもらっているんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't live in this village, but thanks to an acquaintance who referred me to this town, I'm doing business here.

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺はこの村の住民じゃないが ここで商売を続けるには、 村の人に従うしかないんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't live in this village but in order to continue doing business here, I have to obey the villagers.

Entry.JapaneseText: 早く出てったほうがいい。 それから俺にはなるべく 話しかけないでくれ……すまん。
Entry.EnglishText: The sooner you leave, the better. And speak to me as little as possible... Sorry.

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたとは話したくない…… 村の人がそう言うからじゃない。 あんたがガジュマだからさ……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't wish to speak with you... Not because the villagers say so, it's because you're a Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマが憎く思えて 仕方ないんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: I can't help but hate Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: でもこの村はガジュマのほうが 多いし……耐えるのに必死さ。 お金を稼ぐって、大変だよなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: But in this village there are many Gajuma... I'm desperate, so I have to endure it. Earning money is difficult, you know...

Entry.Notes: What is this lmao. I just copied and pasted the JP Gat or

Entry.JapaneseText: もうここでは商売できないかと 思ってたんだけど……助かったよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I thought I wouldn't be able to continue doing business here... I'm saved.

Entry.JapaneseText: 他の街へ行くってのもアリだけど、 固定客をつかむまでが大変だからね。
Entry.EnglishText: While it's also possible to go to another town, it's hard to get a fixed clientele.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何の音なのかね…… 俺は周りがうるさくても 寝られるタイプだからいいけど……
Entry.EnglishText: What's that noise...? I'm the kind of person who can sleep even if it's noisy around, so I guess it's fine...

Entry.JapaneseText: この村はお年寄りが多いから みんな気になって夜もろくに 眠れないみたいだよ……
Entry.EnglishText: This village is full of old people. Everyone's so worried about them that they can't sleep...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマとガジュマが争ってると 商売がやりにくいんだよなぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: When Huma and Gajuma are quarreling with each other, it's difficult to do business.

Entry.JapaneseText: モメる原因ってのは、 わからなくもないんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: Regarding the cause of their quarrel, I have no idea...

Entry.JapaneseText: 人が遊んでる時、人が働かない時に 稼ぐのが商人ってもんさ。
Entry.EnglishText: When people are enjoying themselves and not working, that's when we make money.

Entry.JapaneseText: 今がまさにその時…… がんばって稼がないとな。
Entry.EnglishText: This is the perfect time... I have to do my best to earn money.

Entry.JapaneseText: 将来は自分の店を持つのが 目標なんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: My goal is to have my own store in the future.

Entry.JapaneseText: またどうぞー！
Entry.EnglishText: See you again!

Entry.JapaneseText: 外はバイラスでいっぱいだよ。 あ、あんたら……平気かい？
Entry.EnglishText: There's a ton of Biruses outside. Y-You guys... Will you be ok?

Entry.JapaneseText: どこかに医者はいないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you know where we can find a doctor?

Entry.JapaneseText: ちょっと忙しいんだ…… 他をあたっておくれ……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm busy right now. Ask someone else.

Entry.JapaneseText: 忙しいんだよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm busy, you know...

Entry.JapaneseText: フランツさんに まかせるしかないな……
フランツさんに まかせるしかないよネ……
<Annie>の事は、フランツさんに まかせて、外で待つしかない……
ここは、フランツさんに まかせるしかないぜ……
私たちにできる事は 待つ事だけよ……
外で待つしか……
Entry.EnglishText: We have to wait outside...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: ようこそ。
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 食材を買う 泊まる 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy ingredients Rest Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: どんな食材が欲しい？
Entry.EnglishText: What kind of ingredients do you want?

Entry.JapaneseText: またどうぞ、おいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>ひと晩<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが いかがですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>How about <unk17:340C80> gald for staying the night?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>You'll pay <unk17:340C80> gald for staying overnight. Will you stay?
Entry.Notes: Check dups for space in the beginning Gator

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: You'll pay as if you're staying <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>. Will you stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>You'll pay <unk17:340C80> gald for staying overnight. Will you stay?

Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>You'll pay <unk17:340C80> gald for staying overnight. Will you stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>泊まんのかい……？ <unk17:340C80>ガルド置いてきな。
<font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど、 泊まるかい？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>It's <unk17:340C80> gald for staying overnight. Will you stay?

Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>You'll pay <unk17:340C80> gald for staying overnight. Will you stay?

Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>You'll pay <unk17:340C80> gald for staying overnight. Will you stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>You'll pay <unk17:340C80> gald for staying overnight. Will you stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど、 泊まる？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>It's <unk17:340C80> gald for staying overnight. Will you stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 よろしいでしょうか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>You'll pay <unk17:340C80> gald for staying overnight. Will you stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>You'll pay <unk17:340C80> gald for staying overnight. Will you stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドだ。 どうする？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>It will be <unk17:340C80> gald for staying overnight. Will you stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まるかい？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>It will be <unk17:340C80> gald. Will you stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まるかい？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>It will be <unk17:340C80> gald. Will you stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まりますか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>It will be <unk17:340C80> gald. Will you stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まりますか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>It will be <unk17:340C80> gald. Will you stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドで泊りますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002><unk17:340C80> Gald to rest. Spend the night?? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりどうぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Please proceed inside.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Have a good night.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Have a good night.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Have a good night.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Have a good night.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Please relax and enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Have a good night.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Have a good night.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Have a good night.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Please relax and enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお寛ぎください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please relax and make yourself at home.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Have a good night.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうぞ、ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Please relax and enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Please relax and enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうぞ、ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Please relax and enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり、どーぞー。
Entry.EnglishText: Please proceed inside.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようですね。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: 金がないのに、 泊まる気だったのかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Were you going to stay overnight despite not having money?

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないみたいね。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: 泊まり賃をお持ちでないようですが。
Entry.EnglishText: It doesn't seem like you can pay the fare for staying.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: あれ？ お金が足りないみたいだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Huh? It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないんじゃが……
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have enough money, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りませんが……
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have enough money, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足らないんですけど……
Entry.EnglishText: Even though you don't have enough money...

Entry.JapaneseText: それでは またの機会に。
Entry.EnglishText: Well then, until next time.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: I hope you will come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またどうぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: I hope you will come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: I hope you will come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ふん…… ひやかしかい……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Hmmm... Are you just looking at the goods?

Entry.JapaneseText: またおいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Come again soon.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: I hope you will come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: I hope you will come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: I hope you will come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またおいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Come again soon.

Entry.JapaneseText: またのお越しを。
Entry.EnglishText: Come again in the future.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: I hope you will come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだ、 泊まらないのか……？
Entry.EnglishText: What? Aren't you going to stay...?

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでもどうぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: You're always welcome!

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでもおいで。
Entry.EnglishText: You're always welcome.

Entry.JapaneseText: お気をつけて……
Entry.EnglishText: Take care...

Entry.JapaneseText: 泊まらないんですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Aren't you going to stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: 話す事なんかないよ…… 用が済んだら、とっとと 出て行くんだね。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't have anything to discuss with you... If you're finished, leave right away.

Entry.JapaneseText: さっさと出て行きな！
Entry.EnglishText: Leave immediately!

Entry.JapaneseText: 前から取引してたヒューマの 業者が、ウチにはもう卸さない って言い出してさ……
Entry.EnglishText: The Huma vendor with whom we've been doing business with for a while won't sell wholesale to us anymore.

Entry.JapaneseText: おかげで仕入れに四苦八苦さ。 なんとか品はそろえてるけどさ、 困っちゃうわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Due to this, it's been hard to stockup. I've managed to collect some goods, but I'm in a difficult situation...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんた、ヒューマ……よね？ ま、いいわ……こっちの話。
Entry.EnglishText: You... You're a Huma, right? Well, it's ok... Over here.
Entry.Notes: Not sure about the last part.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマにはあんまり ウチで買い物して欲しく ないんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't want Huma to shop at our place...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマには色々思うところは あるけど……おかみさんには お世話になってたし……
Entry.EnglishText: I have many feelings about Huma, but... The Miss has been a great help to me...

Entry.JapaneseText: とりあえず、宿屋は 私が引き継いだのよ……
Entry.EnglishText: For now, I'm taking over the inn, you know...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマには色々思うところは あるけど……おかみさんには お世話になってたし……
Entry.EnglishText: I have many feelings about Huma, but... The Miss has been a great help to me...

Entry.JapaneseText: とりあえず、宿屋は 私が引き継いだのよ……
Entry.EnglishText: For now, I'm taking over the inn, you know...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマには色々思うところは あるけど……おかみさんには お世話になってたし……
Entry.EnglishText: I have many feelings about Huma, but... The Miss has been a great help to me...

Entry.JapaneseText: とりあえず、宿屋は 私が引き継いだのよ……
Entry.EnglishText: For now, I'm taking over the inn, you know...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマも悪いとは思うけど おかみさんの事は心配だったし……
Entry.EnglishText: I have many feelings about Huma, but... I worry about the Miss...

Entry.JapaneseText: またおかみさんと一緒に 商売ができて嬉しいよ。
Entry.EnglishText: With her by my side, I'm happy to be doing business again.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマも悪いとは思うけど おかみさんの事は心配だったし……
Entry.EnglishText: I think badly of Huma, but I worry about the Miss...

Entry.JapaneseText: またおかみさんと一緒に 商売ができて嬉しいよ。
Entry.EnglishText: With her by my side, I'm happy to be doing business again.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマも悪いとは思うけど おかみさんの事は心配だったし……
Entry.EnglishText: I think badly of Huma, but I worry about the Miss...

Entry.JapaneseText: またおかみさんと一緒に 商売ができて嬉しいよ。
Entry.EnglishText: With her by my side, I'm happy to be doing business again.

Entry.JapaneseText: この音はなんなのかねえ…… いつ終わるのかねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: What is this sound...? When will it end...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマも悪いとは思うけど おかみさんの事は心配だったし……
Entry.EnglishText: I think badly of Huma, but I worry about the Miss...

Entry.JapaneseText: またおかみさんと一緒に 商売ができて嬉しいよ。
Entry.EnglishText: With her by my side, I'm happy to be doing business again.

Entry.JapaneseText: まだみんなぎこちないけど、 少しずつ仲直りし始めてるよ。 なんだか嬉しいね……
Entry.EnglishText: We're still a bit awkward, but we're starting to get along little by little. I'm somehow happy...

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだか、悪い事したねえ…… タダにはできないけど、 ゆっくり見てっとくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: You've done something bad... I can't give it for free, but take your time and look.

Entry.JapaneseText: またおいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Come again soon.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 食材を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy ingredients Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: 何の用だね……？
Entry.EnglishText: What can I do for you...?

Entry.JapaneseText: どんな食材が欲しい？
Entry.EnglishText: What kind of ingredients do you want?

Entry.JapaneseText: 用が済んだら、 とっとと出て行きな。
Entry.EnglishText: If you're finished, leave right away.

Entry.JapaneseText: またどうぞ、おいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again soon.

Entry.JapaneseText: 病気の者は うちには泊めないよ！
Entry.EnglishText: I don't give shelter to those who are ill!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……早くその娘さんを 手当てしてやっておくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Give some medical treatment to that girl soon.

Entry.JapaneseText: あの子が治る事を祈ってるよ…… 村の人が病気にかかってない事もね……
Entry.EnglishText: I'll pray for her to get better... The people in the village never get ill...

Entry.JapaneseText: よく来たの。
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 泊まる 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140> Rest Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: 特に話す事はないよ。 余分にしゃべると 暑くなるだけさ……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't have any particular thing to talk about. If you speak more than necessary, it will get hotter...

Entry.JapaneseText: 出て行きな！ まだ死にたかないんだよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Get out of here! I don't want to die yet!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あんまり言いたかないけど、 ガジュマと話すとどうにも 気持ちが高ぶるのさ……
Entry.EnglishText: ...I can't say much, but upon speaking to Gajuma I feel uplifted
Entry.Notes: Not sure about this one because of the どうにも

Entry.JapaneseText: 商売がら、ガマンしてるけど こんな事、六十年生きてきて 初めてさね……
Entry.EnglishText: Due to the nature of my job, I put up with this kind of things, but this is the first time in my sixty years of life...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あんたら、ガジュマと 一緒にいて平気かね……？ あたしゃ、イライラしっぱなしさ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...You guys, are you ok with being around Gajuma? As for me, I get nervious.

Entry.JapaneseText: 商売がら、ガマンしてるけど こんな事、六十年生きてきて 初めてさね……
Entry.EnglishText: Due to the nature of my job, I put up with these kinds of things, but this is a first in my sixty years of living...

Entry.JapaneseText: なんか最近、ガジュマを見ると、 イライラするのさ……
Entry.EnglishText: For some reason, when I look at Gajuma lately, I get irritated.

Entry.JapaneseText: こんな事じゃいけないねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: This isn't it...

Entry.JapaneseText: 特に話題はないんだけど…… すいませんね。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't have anything particular to discuss... Sorry.

Entry.JapaneseText: 食材屋の彼女、あたしの代わりに 宿屋を守ってくれてたんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: She, the food vendor, protected the inn in my place.

Entry.JapaneseText: こういう人もいるってのに どうしてあたしはガジュマに 腹を立ててたのかねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: Why am I so angry with Gajuma when people like her exist...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 嵐の前に空が騒ぐ時があるけど、 こんな音は、六十年生きて来て 初めて聞いたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Sometimes you can hear the sky before a storm, this is the first time I hear a sound like this in my sixty years of living.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何なのかねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: What is it...?

Entry.JapaneseText: あちこちでヒューマとガジュマが ケンカしてるって話を聞くけど うちはうまくやってるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I hear that Huma and Gajuma are fighting around the world, but we're doing fine over here.

Entry.JapaneseText: 当たり前だとは思うけど、 幸せだって思うね。
Entry.EnglishText: I know it's obvious, but we are pretty blessed.

Entry.JapaneseText: 嵐の前に雲行きが怪しい事はあるけど、 こんなヘンな空は、六十年の人生で 初めてだよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Sometimes the clouds look menacing before a storm, but this is the first time I've seen such a strange sky like this in my sixty years of living.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……こんなヘンピな村だけど イイ部屋を用意してるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Even if this village is very remote, I'm preparing a good room.
Entry.Notes: The most perfect translation for this may be different than the one provided below.

Entry.JapaneseText: またの。
Entry.EnglishText: See you.
